page.title: 11 Old People's Home,Wideopen
page.content: Parkside Crt.is sheltered housing. Old people have own flats, a warden and communal area.Warden knew Wideopen when she came on hiking parties. There was the odd shop and the Travellers' Rest Pub which some recall being called Mary Gallons. She sold tired miners cider and sandwiches and gave hay and water to cart horses. The Children's park is site of quarry and the home is where the old Quarry House was.Local walls are of stone from this quarry.Co-op store was Reno picture house. There were only 4 buses a day. Residents remembered war-time rations; e.g. 8oz of meat a week.Another resident was a mounted policeman and then a motor patrol moving every 4 or 5 years. You could only get married after 5 years in the police. He remembers Wideopen as a small village.
